availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Hambleton (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, county judge and county clerk)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, county judge and county clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Rosanna Hambleton. Resident of Breckinridge County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. County judge of the Breckinridge County Court in 1860. Clerk of the Breckinridge County Court from 1865 to 1866.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 1, p. 114. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 1, p. 663. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Hardinsburg, p. 22. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1866,” in 1866 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 347-350.
